qas.question: What was the RCC's view of political parties?

answers.text: Ruling by decree, the RCC maintained the monarchy's ban on political parties,
In September 1971, Gaddafi resigned, claiming to be dissatisfied with the pace of reform, but returned to his position within a month.
In February 1973, he resigned again, once more returning the following month.

qas.question: What was the impact of incorporating the sharia into the legal system?

answers.text: united secular and religious law codes

qas.question: In what year did the Revolutionary Intellectuals Seminar occur?
What did the RCC outlaw in 1970?
In what month and year did Gaddafi first resign?
In what year did Gaddafi's second resignation occur?

context: In May <a4_0>1970<a4_0/>, the Revolutionary Intellectuals Seminar was held to bring intellectuals in line with the revolution, while that year's Legislative Review and Amendment <a3_0>united secular and religious law codes<a3_0/>, introducing sharia into the legal system. <a0_0>Ruling by decree, the RCC maintained the monarchy's ban on political parties,<a0_0/> in May 1970 banned <a5_0>trade unions<a5_0/>, and in 1972 outlawed workers' strikes and suspended <a6_0>newspapers<a6_0/>. <a1_0>In <a7_0>September 1971<a7_0/>, Gaddafi resigned, claiming to be dissatisfied with the pace of reform, but returned to his position within a month.<a1_0/> <a2_0>In February <a8_0>1973<a8_0/>, he resigned again, once more returning the following month.
